inclusion.criterion: Chief complaint consistent with asthma exacerbation
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Previous diagnosis of asthma by a physician OR one major in the Asthma Predictive Index (API) with two prior episodes of wheezing in the past year.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Major criteria in the API: parent with asthma, patient with eczema, evidence of sensitization to allergens in the air
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Received oral corticosteroids as part of treatment during this visit for acute asthma exacerbation.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Deemed well enough after interventions to be discharged by the treating physician.
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: Received asthma controller medications within four weeks prior to presentation or an allergy to intervention asthma controller mediations.
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Patients will be randomized using a random number generator to the intervention group, or standard care (control) group in a 1:1 ratio. Patients assigned to the intervention group will be subject to initiation of an asthma controller medication upon discharge.
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Patients <5 years of age or patients who prefer nebulized medications will receive a one month supply of low dose Pulmicort (budesonide) solution 0.25mg/respule to be given twice a day via nebulizer.
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Patients ≥5 years of age will receive one low dose QVAR (Beclometasone dipropionate) metered-dose inhaler (MDI) 40mcg/puff with instructions to take it two puffs twice a day with spacer.
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Patients allocated to the control group will not receive an asthma controller medication from the PED.
exclusion.label: not_met

notes: The patient is a 15-year-old boy with asthma diagnosed a year ago. He presents with shortness of breath, chest tightening and cough.
